13121112212112.title: No - this is just too embarrassing

131211122121121.content:
Well, school over for the week, and what a funny week this has been. At the beginning of the week you hadn’t quite expected that you would now be involved in a humanities project, and definitely would not have considered being nominated as the subject of a behavioral sciences project. Of course the least likely thing was that you would now be planning to spend part of the Semester masquerading as a girl – assuming that you can actually pull this off.

You unexpectedly received your mom’s unconditional backing for the project, you’ve have had an initial lesson on how to apply makeup, dressing as a girl, and are now applying HRT patches daily, plus, for some odd reason, also using lavender shampoo and tea tree oil body wash.

However, you are now decidedly uncertain about the project – or at least your role in it. Whilst you did decide earlier in the week that you’d give this your total commitment, the reality of seeing yourself wearing girls’ clothes did not fill you with any confidence that you’d convince anyone that you’re a girl.

Amy has suggested that the project team meets up over the weekend to try to put each of the component parts together, and try to build your confidence in trying to look and behave like a girl. Well, for the moment you need to carry on with your normal schedule, so first thing tomorrow morning (Saturday) you have a soccer game planned. Your mom has agreed for the girls to come to your house late morning to concentrate on the project.

So, you now have this evening to yourself – possibly the last for a while without having one of the team monitoring what you’re doing and trying to record your interactions and responses – although perhaps a bit pointless when you’re on your own!

After the slightly embarrassing session with Amy, you decide that you will spend this evening doing some on-line research of your own. You are still determined to make this project a success, but also to try to enjoy the experience as much as possible. So you head to your room, sit down at your PC and start surfing, on the lookout for anything to improve the chances of success.

You disregard anything relating to clothes and makeup, as the girls seem to have these under control. However, you are not too sure about the estrogen patches that Louise provided – and which you have been changing daily as instructed. Whilst you think you understand the overall concept, you haven’t noticed any changes yet – even with the double doses - although you’re not really sure how long before any changes could be visible.

A few searches result in more information about HRT, but also identify a number of other things that could be used to help make a boy look more like a girl – like anti-androgens to help control body hair growth. Whilst you don't need to shave yet, you do have body and leg hair inappropriate for a girl. You also find something new - a breast and nipple hormone cream to rub into your breast area to promote faster results . Along with the oestrogen and anti-androgens this should give noticeable results in in hopefully only a couple of weeks. Ideal! You call down to your mom to tell her there's something you need to buy online for the project, and she immediately agrees that you can use her credit card to buy it, without you even having to explain what is it! Job done - with express delivery please!

You find that a number of the sites are related to gender reassignment - which you find a little disconcerting, as this is clearly not your objective, merely an equivalent visual impression for the project, and you try to reassure yourself that what you are doing is fully reversible – which as far as you can determine it is.

However, all that aside, they have not done what you asked of them, and have violated your body.

"Well, um.." you start again. "I really don't think that you should have..." you start, about to embark into a major complaint about what they have done to you, but are immediately interrupted by Amanda, who drowns out everything that you were trying to say. "Well, perhaps we shouldn't have done everything quite so thoroughly as we did, but we felt that you were worth it. You have such a nice figure it really was crying out for some treatment to suit it, and you have a lovely tone to your skin. Your previous efforts at looking like a girl were really quite amateurish, and it was clear from what you said that you wanted it done properly."

"What I said was that I wanted all of the previously stuff removed" you reply, "and..."

"That's right," Amanda interrupts again, you said the last thing you wanted was to be wearing a wig and amateurish makeup, so we've replaced the wig with real hair extensions, and replaced all of your schoolgirl makeup with professional quality kit. Now you really do look like a proper girl, and we thought we could celebrate the transformation with you." As she speaks she pops the cork from the bottle of champagne, pours some into a glass and pushes it into your hand.

OK, you need to get your thoughts straight. Did you actually say you wanted them to make you look like a boy again? What Amanda has said about not wanting to wear a wig and amateurish makeup has struck something of a chord in your memory, so you'd better be sure of yourself before you make too many accusation. Meanwhile you realize you haven't drunk anything for ages and your throat is quite dry, so you drink the champagne in the glass. The bubbles make you cough slightly. Amanda has meanwhile poured out a glass each for Lucy and herself, and seeing you drink yours immediately refills it.

"Come on then," Lucy says, "let's have that twirl. I want to see what that dress looks like on you - you really do have the figure for it."

"I'm not sure if..." you start, but then decide to shut up for a moment. You drink down the refilled glass (so as not to spill any when rotating) and then spin around 360 degrees. You can feel the hem of the dress floating outwards and lagging slightly behind as you rotate around, and can feel the air movement on your silky smooth legs, which actually gives you a bit of a kick. Lucy is grinning like a Cheshire cat "That really is brilliant. You look fantastic! You must be really happy now."

Amanda tops up your glass again, and you drink it down. Somehow you are not feeling quite so annoyed about everything now. You know they shouldn't have done what they did, but you do actually feel quite good. After all, you do look really, well, sexy now - something nobody would ever have described you as being previously- , and everything that Lucy is saying is really bolstering your confidence. The champagne is starting to give you a bit of a buzz, and dulling your sense of anger. Perhaps it would be OK to stay like this for a little while longer, and then you can get Amanda to remove all the makeup and get you back to looking like a boy later on... after all, it's only makeup and clothes, and you are starting to feel more comfortable about it all, so why spoil the mood now?

Despite thinking that perhaps you wouldn't mind staying dressed as you are a little longer, the prospect of going outside and potentially being seen like this is really a step too far. "I, um, don't have a coat, and it's probably getting a bit cooler out now..." you say, ignoring that fact that you are currently feeling quite hot, possibly as a result of three glasses of champagne. "Beside, the reason I came in here originally was to get away from some guys from my school as I didn't want them to recognize me. I don't want to risk running into them again."

"Well, to be truthful there's no much chance of bumping into them now," Amanda responds, "but even if you did I'm pretty sure they wouldn't recognize you. "Great, then that's settled." Lucy jumps in. "We can go for a bite to eat something inside the mall, so we'll all keep warm, and then decide what to do later on."

You don't really like being pressured into making decisions, but you realize you are quite hungry, and if you stay inside the mall you shouldn't really see many people. At least you could then get Amanda to bring you back to the salon to take off the makeup later on, so maybe it wouldn't be too bad.

Today you have the next meeting of the Behavioral Sciences project, and to be honest since the first rather abortive session at the beginning of the week, your views on the subject have changed completely, and you are really looking forward to explaining to the girls what you now know about yourself, and that you are now more that merely keen to participate in the project, but actually desperate to be involved, as this will enable you to fast-track to becoming your new self by being able to dress properly as a girl, even if your external body is not yet fully suited for it.

Fortunately you don't have long to wait before the Behavioral Sciences class starts, and you get together with the rest of the original group. You have no hesitation in outlining everything that has happened since the beginning of the week, and your enlightenment about your belief that you are really a girl, but somehow were born as a boy. Therefore you have totally changed your mind since the earlier session, and now want to participate fully, which from your persepctive is your best and quickest opportunity to start dressing as you feel you really should be.

"Well that's fantastic Tony!" Rachael exclaims.

You cut in to stop her there. "Actually I don't really think I want to be called Tony any more. I'd prefer if you call me Antonia. It sort of feels a bit more like the new 'me'."

"Oh, right." Rachael looks slightly taken aback. "This really is better than I could possibly have hoped." She gives a tentative thumbs up to the others, although they are not all quite so confident. Susan pipes up with her observation on the matter.

"I'm not really sure how we are going to be able to make a worthwhile compilation of behavioral reactions given this turn of events. The original concept was to measure impacts on a person living as the opposite gender, which involved us having a boy dressing and living as a girl. If we continue with Tony - sorry, Antonia dressing as a girl when he, um she, believes herself to be a girl, it sort of negates the whole concept. I'm not really sure how well our project would stand up to scrutiny."

"Well, surely we can still adapt the scope to match the situation?" Rachael responds, clearly not expecting any adverse feedback to her plan. "After all, we are still looking for Antonia to be dressing completely differently to before, so he, um she, will still be potentially acting differently based on the clothes..."

"Well no. As a boy he dressed as a boy. Now that he believes he's a girl, he wants to dress as a girl, so there's no adverse behaviors to compare, and certainly trying to determine if a boy would start behaving as a girl by being dressed as a girl would be impossible, as he already thinks he is a girl!"

"Look, I'm sorry if I've changed since we last discussed this, but as I recall we only had one shot at putting together the project scope which you all agreed matched the brief. I just want to carry on with the project now. Can't we somehow adapt the rules?" you ask, looking your best to look vulnerable and incite some sympathy. The thought that they may deny you the chance to borrow some of their clothes is something you don't even want to consider. "Pleeeeease!!"

Not something you've ever needed, although something inside you wants to keep hold of them - just in case. Eventually you come to your senses and put them back, and look at the next shelf down.

More sealed packets - although marginally more interesting - paper panties. Yes! You can now get hold of some real panties without raiding your mom's closet - which you had briefly considered this morning. You open one of the packets and pull out the contents. Well, to be honest if you hadn't read the outside label you wouldn't know they're paper - they are blue with a printed flower design, and have elasticated leg and waist. These all appear to be one size, so you pick up a packet of those too. You respond with YES and fill up your 140 characters with exclamation points. Finally, someone understands you. Interesting that it's Rachael but somehow, somehow she knows your inner girl. 133121.content:
Despite your decision yesterday that whatever happens you won't be dressing as a girl for the humanities project, you are somehow drawn towards looking a bit more closely at what girls actually wear.

Clearly you're not going to be wearing any of it, but now that the topic has been raised, you're quite curious about what girls wear, and why its different to what boys wear. Obviously their shape necessitates them to wear bras, but why is girls' stuff always softer and smoother and tighter fitting, and somehow sexier, um no, nicer?

Now you happen to be outside a shop that could well start to answer some of these questions, and you realize that you're quite interested in finding out. Actually you realize you're incredibly interested in finding out more about girls' clothes, which you know is a bit odd, but you reckon your subconscious is trying to work out an alternative scope for the project - obviously avoiding you having to cross-dress - so you're happy enough to run with the feeling for now.

So you step inside and have a look around. Despite being promoted as a swimwear shop there is quite a range of different clothing inside, ranging from swimsuits and bikinis, halter tops and shorts, beach dresses and romper suits, all the way through to a range of footwear and jewelery.

You head to the female section - actually the bigger part of the store - and start to browse around, feeling some of the materials and admiring the colors and patterns, and increasingly wonder what some of these things would feel like when worn. You assume the softer material would be equally soft on the skin, although you know that merely feeling with your fingers is not a true reflection of how something would feel for real. You're also a bit fascinated by bras. Not why girls wear them, as that's obvious, but what it feels like having something wrapped around just your chest, which seems a bit weird really.

After a few minutes looking around you look up to find one of the shop assistants in front of you. She's in her late teens and you notice she's wearing a purple tee shirt with the store's logo over a pair of sporty gray leggings, with the store's name and logo emblazoned down the side, and a pair of flat sandals.You can just make out the outline of her bra strap through the material of the tee and wonder what color bra she's wearing, and if she has matching panties... You suddenly stop, and are instantly horrified by what you've just be thinking.What the heck are you doing? Why do you care what color underwear she has? What has gotten into you? You try to pull your thoughts together and hope she didn't notice you scanning her clothes...

She smiles at you, and ask you a question.

“Hi. Can I help you at all? Is there anything particular you're looking for?”

Oh crap. You can't say you're just suddenly interested in looking at girls clothes. That would be just pervy. You'll have to come up with something a bit more viable, and quick.

“Oh, hi. No, not really, thanks. I'm just looking because...”

1331213.content:
Realizing that you've been caught out wondering around the female swimwear section without an obvious explanation, you decide to fall back on the safest best. Tell the truth. Or at least a version of the truth.

“I'm involved in a school project. I've been sent out to do some research. I hope you don't mind me looking around?"

“Well, no, of course not. It's just a bit unusual to have a boy wondering around the girls swimwear section, that's all.”

“Yeah, well, to be honest I know what boys swimming trunks are like, so there's not a lot of point me looking at them. I happened to be passing by and noticed you have lots of girls stuff, so I was sort of wondering about them and how they're different.”

“You from the high school then?” You nod, and she continues speaking. “Yeah, I was there until a couple of years ago. I know what their projects are like. So, let me guess. You've only been back a couple of days, the topics have been chosen and signed off for the semester, and you pulled the short straw to go out first?”

Yeah, that's pretty much it.”

“You have my sympathy. I had the same sort of thing happen to me. So, exactly what are you trying to find out?”

“Well, basically I'm trying to find out why different materials are used for girls clothes, why they're styled differently, why girls wear their clothes tighter than boys... Um, everything I can really...”

But it's not just the material itself, but the weave and cut and styling, and most importantly the finish.” You find yourself hanging on her every word, wanting her to continue.

“Um, OK.” You reply. “So where should I start then? I haven't much of a clue what to do really. What would you recommend?”

"Well, I can think of a couple of things that could help..."

“Sorry, but what is a zero reverse supply chain?” you ask, uncertain what she's talking about, and definitely uncertain how it could help you.

“Well, basically something like this.” and she splays out her hands to indicate the store you're in. “This is a manufacturer's outlet, so we get all the end of lines and excess stocks. However, we can't send any returns back, as that would cost, and they don't want them anyway. If we can't sell it, nobody else can. So we end up with a stockpile of unwanted and unsellable clothes.”

“Why unsellable?” you ask.

“Well, generally around 10% of all purchases are returned. That's OK for some things, but we can't resell swimwear that's been returned, even if it's perfect.”

“You mean 10% of everything you sell is returned, and you're stuck with it? Wow.”

“Yes, and with the excess stock they push down to us, last year's designs that nobody wants anymore, plus damaged or faulty stuff, we end up with a store room full of stock that nobody wants.”

“Um, OK... “ you reply, not really sure where this conversation is leading. "So, how could that help me?"

“Oh, that's easy. If you'd like I could pull together a few oddments from the storeroom for you? Then you'd be able to compare the materials directly, and it should at least give you a start...”

“Oh wow. That would be great, thank you.” you respond, not entirely sure if you want a handful of off-cast swimwear and how that could help you... However, you're actually getting a bit of a buzz thinking that you could have some girls clothing in your possession.

“OK, so could you call back later this afternoon? I'll check with the store manager, but she'll say yes anyway, and I'll grab a few things for you.”

OK, so now that you've gone through this all, how will this be able to recalibrate the project scope? Hmm, you're struggling to work out a solution to that one.

However, a thought strikes you...

1331213222131.content:
It's Rachael calling. She says she looked for you after school but couldn't find you. Yeah, OK. That's her problem, you think to yourself. At least you turned up at lunchtime to see her. She's the one who didn't turn up then.

However, you guess you should at least show her a bit of courtesy, so you let her continue. She apologizes for not seeing you at lunchtime. Something cropped up, apparently. Hmm. She tells you she's been looking for options to change the scope of the project to suit you better, but so far hasn't found a viable alternative. Before you have a chance to reiterate your objection to the existing scope she does at least ask if you've had any better luck, so at least she's not yet ruling out a change.

“I'm working on an idea I had.” you explain. “I think we're stuck with a scope that involves genders and clothing, but I was wondering if we could change the scope to look at why girls and boys clothes are made of different materials and constructed and styled differently, and potentially what impacts that might have on someone wearing it.”

“Um, OK.” Rachael replies, and you notice the skepticism in her voice. “So have you worked out how this would work as a project yet?”

You glance at your reflection in the mirror again, and decide that getting together with the others in the group involved at this precise moment would not be a good idea, as if they saw you now they'd immediate stick with their original idea of you cross-dressing!

“OK. May be.” you reply. “I think I need to work through this a bit more. I've got the rough idea, but somehow need to flesh it out a bit first.”

“No worries Tony. Let me know if you want to talk it over. Otherwise we'll see you tomorrow. Maybe you'll have a better idea then. Just one thing – don't be disillusioned by this at all....”

On hearing that your conscious mind shuts down, as you return to the hypnotic state you were in earlier.

“Tony, can you here me?” Rachael says. “You need to speak so that I can hear you.”

Your hypnotized subconscious responds with a slow monotone reply “I hear you.”

“OK, good. Then your next guidance is this..."
1331213222131.title: Rachael

choices: You realize your mom will be home soon
13312132221312.content:
Rachael hangs up after instructing your consciousness to wake up again, and you are totally unaware that anything has occurred beyond a brief conversation with Rachael.

OK, so where were you. Oh, yes, you were considering either the playsuit or the beach dress. Guess with either of them you'd better put on underwear first. You undo the neck strap of the swimsuit, and pull this down, realizing that you almost have to unpeel it to get it off your body. Well, you'll never had to do this with anything before, perhaps with the exception of a wet suit once.

You look at the beach dress. That really ought be worn with underwear, unlike the swimsuit. You reach for your boxers again to put them back on, but stop and think. It would really be a bit silly putting on your own underwear to assess the feel of the dress – you really should put on girls underwear - despite this being contrary to everything you'd been saying to Rachael. Never mind. You need to complete this comparison to see if you can change the scope of the project, and, besides, you're really quite interested in checking out these different materials and styles. You look around to where you'd put the underwear from the store to select something to try. Actually, you want to put on a bra. You're not sure why, but you really want to try on a bra. Now. As soon as you set your eyes on a bra you have an almost desperate urge to put it on. You grab the bra on top of the pile, which (fortunately) you'd previously checked for sizing and pull it on. It's a slip on type, so putting it on is as easy as pulling on a tee. You notice it doesn't really have much shaping as you'd expected, and sits comfortably on your chest. It seems you'd selected a girls sports bra with no defined cups, designed primarily for overall support. Whilst feeling a bit weird its actually really comfortable, and you suddenly feel a lot happier. You then select the matching panties and pull them on.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/b5/a1/06/...

You realize you're actually getting a bit of a buzz out of this, and have to check out your reflection again. OK, a bit weird definitely. A bit tighter or snugger fitting than your own clothes, so they do feel different - but really comfortable. So, why do some women complain at wearing a bra? This feels really quite good...

You drag your thoughts back to the task in hand – trying on the dress. You pick up the beach dress, and put this on like a long tee shirt, head first, then arms, and let it drop down around you.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/be/83/e8/...

The material seem to float rather than fall down, and where it touches your skin it feels soft and silky. Wow. This really is getting somewhere. Yes, based on your limited, um, research, you are definitely concluding there are significant differences between boys and girls clothing, and girls clothes do have nicer clothes and they feel nicer to wear. But how does this fit in to the project? You're still not sure.

You glance again at your reflection, but this time are a bit more taken by what you see. Whilst the bra was quite snug the dress seems to have given you a bit more of what you'd consider a girls shape. It has definite styling, pulling in slightly at the waist, then giving the impression of slightly wider hips and a slight shape to the chest. OK, so what now? You still have a stack of clothes here to do something with, and somehow need to review and amend the project scope so that you don't have to spend the rest of the semester dressed like this.

Either could lead to inaccurate assumptions and potentially embarrassing outcomes. So you'll need to hide everything away and carry on trying to modify the scope a different way. You have a final look in the mirror before you pull off the mermaid beach dress, and fold it, dropping it on the end of your bed. 133121322213121.title: You realize your mom will be home soon

1331213222131211.content:
You wake up the following morning, and realize you'd slept in the bra and panties. Oh yes, you remember now. You were getting ready for bed and felt so comfortable in them that you decided to keep them on for a while – but then clearly fell asleep. Oh well. They were just really comfortable, and to be honest still are. But now you need to get ready for school.

You head into the bathroom and have a shower, and then pad back wrapped in a towel to sort out what you'll wear for school. You pull open a couple of drawers in your closet revealing some of the girls underwear laid on top of your own. Well, technically its just underwear, so its as good there as anywhere... You rummage down to find a pair of your boxers, but pull out a pair of panties by mistake. Hmm, if you can find the matching bra, that might be a goer, you contemplate, getting a bit of a buzz remembering how they were so comfortable yesterday. Actually, against your better judgment, you feel you'd like to wear a bra again. It really did feel nice, and, well, under your clothes nobody would ever know. You know you shouldn't, and know it contravenes what you consider to be your highest principles, but you continue to find the matching bra to the panties nevertheless, and put them both on. These are styled the same as the previous ones, and fit equally well. You finish dressing, check yourself over, and head to the kitchen for breakfast.

Your mom has your breakfast ready for you, although as ever its almost shoveling food in as you pack your bag and pull your shoes on, and within a few minutes you're heading out of the door.

Fortunately school is within walking distance, and in about 20 minutes you arrive. Shortly before you start your first class there's a message on your phone. Rachael again – asking how you're getting on, and suggesting a get together at lunchtime. Yeah, may be she'll actually turn up this time.

Well, last night you did come up with a rough outline of an idea, although its all very tentative, and you're not sure if the project group would buy into it. Well, the sooner you explain to Rachael and the others, the better, as at least you'll know if they're going to accept your idea, or if you need to come up with something else. You message her back confirming you'll be able to meet up later. Then you get stuck into classes, forgetting entirely that you're wearing a bra and panties, they're so comfortable...
1331213222131211.title: Next morning

choices: What do you think about reducing the scope to just the team?
13312132221312111.content:
Lunchtime arrives, and you go to where Rachael suggested you meet up. True to her word, the other girls are there too (Susan, Amy and Louise), so that you can share your idea for the change to the project scope. So you start to explain.

"OK, so my understanding is that we need a topic related to either sociological or psychological attitudes or behaviors. Because of what was suggested at the beginning of the week we seem to be stuck with something related to clothes. What I'm thinking is we look at the differences in the materials used, and the styles of clothing for the different genders, and why they are different, in other words why the types of clothes and their styles are so different."

"OK," Susan chips in, "I get that, but it doesn't cover off the key requirement which is looking at the sociological or psychological impacts. The, um, previous scope was for one person to take the role of the opposite gender to seen what the impacts are. How do you propose we assess the impacts of the historic development of clothing for different genders."

"Um, well, I must admit I got a bit stuck there, but I thought we may be able to incorporate some styling changes into the school uniform, and see how the changes are accepted, or not..."

"So potentially we get the school to sponsor a wholesale design change to the school uniform, incorporating gender specific elements, and then assess who like the changes? Somehow I can't see the Head agreeing to that..."

The fact that you really hadn't thought this through terribly well is starting to worry you now. It seemed quite straightforward as you considered it last night. But you hadn't reckoned on them arguing about it.. You attempt to continue. "Well, not exactly changing the design, but changing some of the uniform rules so that gender specific items are no longer mandatory, or maybe different items are made mandatory instead."

"Um, I think I'm getting it." Rachael says. "So the rules changes, so girls don't have to wear a black skirt and white knee high socks, but could wear pants instead?"

"Yes, that's it!" you reply, relieved that perhaps this idea may work. "So not redesigning the uniform, just changing how it's used..."

"OK, so which rules do you suggest are changed? They're got to be gender specific ones to fit your scope..."

Louise now chips in "Oh, so you mean any rule specifically targeted on one or the other gender could be up for grabs?"

"Um, potentially yes," you reply.

"But it wouldn't really work if it was optional, would it?"

"Eh? What do you mean?"

“Well, everyone knows how reluctant people are to change, so given a choice of sticking to the existing gender specific rules, or optionally changing to something else, the vast majority would stay with what they know. That's a fact."

"So," Rachael says, "you mean this would only work if the changes were mandatory?"

"Pretty much, yes." Louise responds.

"But we can't go so far as to swap uniforms entirely.” Rachael replies. “There are some boys I would definitely not want to see wearing a skirt and knee high socks."

"No, I wasn't thinking about a total swap!" you jump in. You realize that would be even worse than the original scope, by making the entire school cross-dress, with you doubtless getting the blame for it. Besides, it would definitely not be accepted by the school. "I was thinking we would only impose small changes and then assess how well they're accepted..."

"Ah, OK. I see." Rachael replies. "So we start by introducing a mandatory uniform change that, I don't know, all girl must wear boy's boxer shorts instead of panties."

"Um, yes, that's the sort of thing, I guess." you respond, not really sure if that's what you meant or not."

"And if that works OK," Rachael continues, "the next rule could be that all boys must wear a bra. I'm not sure how well that would go down."

"Um, maybe...." You're well aware that you're wearing a bra now. Whilst you clearly don't want to admit that to the girls, it's so comfortable that you can't see why any boys wouldn't want to wear one...

"OK, so I think this will need a bit more work before we can realistically present it for approval. We'll need to draw up a list of gender specific rules first."

"You mean like boys aren't allowed to have their hair reaching their shoulders?" Amy asks.

"Or wear make-up." Louise says.

"OK, so our time is up for now." Rachael says, clearly trying to bring the meeting to a close. Let's all work on Tony's idea and meet up again later and see if we can work out a clearer scope?"

Everyone agrees, and you get set to leave. "Oh, Tony, just before you go," Rachael says, "could I just have a quick word?" The other girls leave, with only Rachael and you remaining. She starts speaking.
13312132221312111.title: Explaining your new project scope

133121322213121112.content:
"Well Tony, I'm glad you've been thinking about the scope, although I'm not yet convinced this idea would be accepted by the school. I think the idea is for us to manage everything within the team, rather than involving the whole school, so I could see we could have a challenge there... What would you feel about reducing the scope to include just the team, rather than the whole school? I do think you may have hit on a good idea and I'm sure we could make it work with a bit of tweaking.”

OK, so Rachael is basically agreeing to a change to the scope so that you're not forced to cross-dress. OK, you know the revised scope you've basically cobbled together isn't perfect, but you've managed to persuade them to adopt a change so you won't be forced to wear girls clothes - although to be honest your view on that has been changed a bit after you tried on the bra and panties yesterday and found them so comfortable. But you're only wearing them now because you want to, not because you're being told to. There's a difference.

“I guess that would make sense,” you reply. “I guess it was a bit ambitious thinking we could get the whole school involved.”

“So based on what you suggested earlier we could introduce mandatory rules for specific members of the team, so for starters that the girls wear boxers instead of panties...”

“Okay... “ you reply, temporarily imagining Rachael wearing boxers under her school uniform skirt.

She continues. “So, Susan would need to observe and record any impacts, so how the person involved feels about it, and how this affects them and anyone around them. OK, so far?”

“Um, yeah, I guess.”

“So after that we move onto a different change, so for example the boys in the team have to wear a bra.”

Um, right. “Yeah, that's basically what we said.”

“And you're OK with that?”

“Um, yeah.” You are suddenly very conscious of the bra that you have on under your uniform, although confident that it cannot be seen. Are you OK with wearing a bra - well, yes. Despite all of your previous prejudices and worries about wearing girls clothes, you really like wearing the bra - but you're clearly not going to tell Rachael that... “I guess if its part of what we agree then I wouldn't have an issue.”

“OK, so from the original scope that we discussed what was your primary issue?”

“Well, me having to cross-dress and pretend to be a girl.”

“But you're OK if we select specific items to swap or change for members of the team, like the boxers or bra, or perhaps other thing gender related things we agree on?”

Thinking of the girls in the project team wearing boxers, or possibly going without a bra, seems like a positive move for you. And for you to have to wear a bra? Well, you are already, and somehow it doesn't seem such a big deal now, so potentially its a no-brainer... “Yes, that sounds OK.”

“OK then. Thanks. I just wanted to be sure I understood your idea for the project... By the way...”
133121322213121112.title: Changing the scope?

1331213222131211121.content:
After Rachael utters these words you again return to the hypnotic state, with your consciousness again put on hold.

Rachael starts speaking again. “OK, so because we need to limit the project scope to within the team you think it would be a good idea to extend any changes beyond just clothing, to include other gender related things, like hair styling, makeup,and jewelry. You've often wondered about make-up, and wonder what it would be like to have on. Now that its your project scope, you want to take the lead role, so whatever change is agreed you'll want to try it first. Oh, and each time a new change is suggested you'll get a buzz, and want to include it in scope.”

She clicks her fingers to bring you back to consciousness again, and as you wake up, she finishes the sentence that she hadn't really started...

“... I'm proud of you, and glad I'm on the same team as you.”

You're aware that you were somehow not quite listening to Rachael, but not why, and assume you had just tuned out momentarily. “Um, yeah, right.”

“So catch up later on, OK?” Rachael says.

“Um, yeah, sure. Um, just one thing...” You know there's something you want to say, but cannot quite grasp it. Oh yes, someone mentioned make-up earlier, which was a bit beyond what you'd been considering for the project, being primarily focused on clothing. You've never really thought about make-up but now that the subject has been raised, you are suddenly quite interested in what it's like to wear. “Someone mentioned other, um, gender related rules aside from clothes.”

“Oh, yes, I think Louise mentioned something.”

“Well, I see no reason why we need to limit the scope to just clothes, so guess we can add some other things.” you reply.

“Well, it's your scope now, so if you want to include other things then I guess you can.” Rachael picks up her bag. “So, perhaps we could include make-up as one of the gender related rules?"

Suddenly you feel weirdly excited about what Rachael has just suggested. "Yes, definitely!" you reply without hesitation, realizing this fits in with what you were just thinking yourself.

13312132221312111211.content:
After school you decide not to go straight home, but instead head to the mall. After your success yesterday in the swimwear store, and what you think is your new idea to extend the scope beyond just clothing, you're keen to look for any new options and maybe investigate a bit more about what make-up is. You know you could ask your mom, but somehow that doesn't feel right. After all she's older so wouldn't understand what you're trying to do. You wonder around and notice a beauty salon. Hmm, not the sort of place you would ever have considered even looking at before, but somehow you're drawn to it. It's quite empty – guess you've hit on a quiet time of day, or something... Well, you decide to go in and see what you can find out - and if you manage to get a couple of samples, then all the better.

Within seconds of entering the salon you are approached by a girl who you estimate to be in her mid-twenties who asks if you need any help. Deciding that the open and honest approach is probably the best you explain that you're from the high school and involved in a project, and you're trying to find out a bit more about make up – admitting that as a boy you have no knowledge of the subject at all!

The assistant looks around, and realizing the salon is actually totally empty of clients, she invites you to sit at one of the manicure desks. For the next 3 or 4 minutes she explains to you the key components of make-up, what they're for and when they're used. Despite your past indifference to the subject you are now quite fascinated and hang on to her every word.

She then shows you a few of the powders and lotions they use in the salon, applying small amounts to the back of your hand, so you can see the effect that each of them would have. However she also explains that some make-up is virtually invisible, and can act as a protective layer for the skin hardly changing the appearance at all.

“So, do you use lip balm in the summer?” She asks.

Well, yes, of course...” you admit.

“So, you're already using make-up! It's just that that one is invisible.”

Crap. You hadn't even considered that. So, technically you're already using make-up? OK, so you're even more interested.

“If you ever use a moisturizer on your face, that's also technically make-up – although that is a bit different as it's absorbed by the skin.”

“Wow,” you reply. “I'd never thought of it like that. I always thought it was what girls put on to cover their spots and blemishes and, well, make them look prettier.”

“Well, there's that side of it as well, of course. Mind you, it isn't only girls who wear make up – some men do as well, although not so much.”

“Yeah, OK. But not proper men – you mean, um...”

“No, I do mean proper men. Yes, there are some bisexuals and so on, but even straight normal guys do sometimes wear make-up – just not the same stuff as girls.”

She continues. "Look, it's gone pretty quiet here now. Would it be helpful if....”

"Would you like me to do your finger nails?"
133121322213121112111.content:
For a second you're not sure if you heard correctly. Did she really offer to put some make-up on you? For some reason you're getting quite a buzz of excitement.

“Um, yes, that would be great. If its no trouble of course... although, can you stick to the invisible stuff?”

“No worries.” She indicates another chair, facing a mirror on the wall – to your mind a bit like a barber's chair. “Come and sit over here, then you can see what I'm doing.” You move across and sit down again. She then pulls a cape over you, covering your clothes up to your neck, exactly as if you were having a hair cut. You then notice they do hair styling here as well. Perhaps not the time to ask about that though. Let's just take this one step at a time...

The assistant cleans you face, and carefully cleans around your eyes, applies what she refers to as BB cream to your face, and a different balm under your eyes, gently blending each in with a little sponge. This is followed by CC, which she explains is color correcting – although with a color that matches your natural skin tone, which effectively makes it invisible, or modifying your natural color to one that is better. You then realize that some spots on your face have disappeared, and the redness around your eyes has reduced. Actually you're quite impressed. She finishes off with eye liner and a balm on your lips. You realize that you don't suddenly look like a girl or anything, but you still look like you, only somehow cleaner and you have to admit actually nicer. Actually this is quite good, and you're feeling really quite buoyant.

You express your appreciation.

“No worries. Happy to help. As I said it's dead in here now, so happy to keep busy doing something anyway, and this makes a change from doing manicures and pedicures.”

“That's like putting on nail varnish?”

“Yes, and no.” she replies. “You really don't know much about it, do you? No, it's not just putting on nail varnish, but the whole process of cleaning, filing, buffing and clipping to have near perfect condition nails, and then adding a base coat, neutral polish, three layers of color polish and two layers of topcoat - which is an additional layer more than other salons. After that they're not only shiny and beautiful, but chip resistant and long lasting... Oh, sorry. I got a bit carried away there. Obviously the color and shiny finish would be for girls!”

“Um, yes. Right.” you reply, trying to dispel the thought of you having your finger nails treated in that way. Hmm, maybe a clear non-shiny option would be preferable if you were ever to...

You decide its probably time to go - potentially before you end up having anything more done to you - although you must admit the make-up does look far better than you'd ever expected.

"So, thanks for your time and help." you say

"As I said, no worries." Then, after a short pause, the girl continues. "Before you leave..."

Checking your watch you realize you should be heading home now, so despite wanting to stay in the mall and try to check out any other stores that may provide some insight or information to help with the project, you reluctantly head home.

On the way you give some thought to what's been happening. It was only three days ago you were put into the humanities project team and subjected to the embarrassment of the suggestion that you'd be the focus of the project and have to cross-dress and pretend to be a girl.

Instead both you and the girls (although you realize you're not entirely sure which ones are actually being included...) will try wearing different gender related items of clothes or other things – like the make-up, to determine the gender related differences, and breaking the accepted gender rules makes you feel.

You've determined there are distinct material and styling differences between boys and girls clothing, and that girls clothes are (so far at least) softer and nicer than boys clothes, and despite your original perceptions, bras are really nice to wear. At least when it comes to you needing to wear girls underwear as one of the project requirements, you know that it wouldn't be an issue. Also, you now know make-up isn't just for making girls look prettier, but serves a sound purpose, and contrary to your original feelings you're actually really happy wearing make-up on - albeit that it's virtually invisible. Basically she seems to have grabbed a random few handfuls of stuff and thrown them in. Oh well, you could perhaps use the neutral color stuff. The rest you guess you could give to one or more of the girls...

You change out of your school clothes, and put on a tee shirt and pair of shorts, although keeping on the bra and panties, which you are reluctant to give up. Then you hear your mom calling you, so you head for the kitchen.

As you arrive you see she has something in her hand. It's...
1331213222131211121111.title: The journey home

13312132221312111211111.content:
Your mom is holding the bra and panties that you wore overnight! OMG - where did she find them? Then you remember - you shoved them into your wash basket this morning without a second thought. Oh crap.

“Hi sweetie. I don't want to pre-judge you or jump to any incorrect assumptions, so perhaps you'll like to tell me whose these are, and why they were in your washing?”

You know full well the options here aren't good. (a) you've had a girlfriend in your room who stripped off and forgot to get dressed again (obviously pretty unlikely as you don't have a girlfriend), or (b) a random girl got changed in your room and left her underwear behind (even less likely) or (c) they're yours - well, technically true but not really what you want to admit to your mom.

Based on your past experience of your mom being able to sniff out a lie at 10 paces, you know whatever you say will need to be at least close to the truth.

“Ah, those, yes.” you try to say an nonchalantly as possible, “They're to do with the new humanities project.”

Your mom gives you a very quizzical look, and you know you'll need to continue.

“For humanities we were put into groups and have a project for the semester. My group is looking at the differences between boys and girls clothes, why they're different, and any sociological or psychological effects they might have. So, we're looking at different clothes, and they were a sample set I got to look at.”

“So obviously they ended up in the wash basket."

"Well, that wasn't intentional. I guess I just threw them in there out of habit."

"So are you habitually washing girls underwear now?"

"No! That's not what I said. I was just keeping my room tidy."

You mom continues. "So, for the project you're comparing the differences between boys and girls clothes?" You nod, and your mom continues. "That shouldn't take long. Then what?"

“Then we look at any gender related uniform rules that apply at school, make small changes to them and assess how well any changes are accepted.”

"I assume you're not talking about the whole school here?"

"Um, no. Just the project team."

“Ah, so let me guess. You swapped underwear with one of the girls in the project?"

“No! We haven't swapped anything. We haven't got as far as that. Those were surplus stock ones that I, we, got from a store in the mall to study."

“So when were you going to tell me about the project?”

“I was going to... I just...” you trail off.

"hadn't got around to it yet..." your mom completes your sentence.

You shrug. “Yeah. Um, yeah."

"Why do I get the feeling that there's more to this than you're saying?"

"There isn't!" you exclaim. "It's just a humanities project looking at clothing and its effect on people."

"But you said gender related, so basically swapping clothes to see what effects there are?"

No. Not swapping. Trying different things to test some of the accepted gender related rules."

"Which could include underwear?" she wiggles the underwear in her hand.

"Well, yes. Potentially."

"And anything else that could be considered gender specific?"

"Well, yes, I guess."

"So, how long before you come home dressed entirely as a girl?

"Never!" you respond immediately. "That is not going to happen! This is limited changes only. I'm not going to dress as a girl..."

Your mom instantly knows she's struck a raw nerve. "OK, so who suggested you might?"

You realize you're not going to get away without telling her pretty much everything, so you decide to own up to the original scope where they proposed you cross-dressed and pretended to be a girl.

"However, I refused point blank when I realized what they wanted me to do. But by that time the project outline was already submitted based on gender related clothing, so I persuaded them to change the scope."

"Ah, OK. Well, good on you for standing your ground. Bet that was hard. I'm not sure how much you've changed the scope though... How many of you are involved?"

"Five. Um, there's Rachael, Susan, Louise, Amy, and me."

"Ah, I see. And are you all going to participate in making the changes?"

"Um, no."

"OK. So how may will be? I guess the project leader won't, and you'll have someone to monitor and record the outcomes..?"

"Um, yeah, I guess. I'm not actually sure of the exact number...."

You mom smiles her all-knowing smile, and you get the feeling she understands something that you don't.

“So, are you happy with the project now, and what you'll be doing?"

"Oh, yeah. Now we've ditched the cross-dressing bit it's quite cool."

You mom sighs. OK, interrogation over young man. Next time talk to me sooner. I may have been able to help, although I guess there are some things you'll just need to find out for yourself.” Oh, and someone did a good job with your make-up - nice and subtle."

Oh blimey, you'd forgotten about that. "Um, right., um. Someone offered so I could see what was involved. I don't..."

"No, I think I get the idea Tony."

Your mom reaches out, and pulls you into a hug. “OK. I'll stop now, and let you sort this out for yourself. I can see what's going on. Just make sure you stick with things you're comfortable with, and don't do anything too stupid, and and I won't ask about anything that turns up in your wash basket."

You feel that needs a response... "Um, right. Thanks."

"OK. Dinner time. Dad won't be home 'til later so it's just you and me sweetie."

This morning you were plain old Tony but now you're glamorous Lucy Vanderhoek, a tall (thanks to your heels) pretty Dutch stewardess in a uniform that doesn't even come close to covering your knees.

"Um, Earth to Lucy. Come in, Lucy" Luna jokes. "Am I going to have to smack you bottom to get your attention again?"

"No ma'am. I've got this" you say.

"Good. This button here brings up flight manifests. You enter a flight number here, or a passenger's name and it automatically locates the αριθμό της θέσης του επιβάτη, κατά προσέγγιση χρόνος ταξιδιού και την εκτιμώμενη ώρα άφιξης..." It was like she was speaking greek, but you tried your best to keep up with her.

After 15 minutes, she asked "Okay, you got this? I'm going to take care of something at the loading ramp. Passengers should start coming in soon for a flight leaving in about 30 minutes, so just do what you can and if you can't help, just be polite. I'll be back in 5."

"Yes ma'am, I'll do my best." you say. Luna looks at you quizzically. "I'm sure you will." she proffers. Before she steps away, she tugs gently at the hem of your jacket to straighten it. "You also have a bit of a sag in your stocking there." she says pointing at your left leg. "You'll want to fix that." With that, she turned and heads off across the gate.

Without thinking, you just know that the best way to snug up your stocking is to grab the top and pull up gently. Grabbing the stocking top through the skirt doesn't work, so, looking around, you pull up your skirt hem, place your fingers in the stocking top and scoot it up. Smoothing the skirt back down, you reach into the waistband and snug up the garter belt to keep it from creeping back down. Finally, you run your hands down your skirt again to make sure it's back in place.

"I love your uniform, sweetie" says a passenger who has walked up to the podium. "Will the flight attendants on the flight be wearing those too?" he asks. You look up to see a tall man in his 30s smiling at you. As you look up, you also notice a security camera you hadn't noticed before. It's pointed right at you with a single LED blinking slowly. That wasn't there earlier, was it?

"Yes, the whole airline is using them. It's a retro thing to help give you a feel for the full Verpletteren experience from days gone by."

"A feel?" he asks. "Hmm. Well, what I'd like to know is whether I could be moved from coach up to first class. I find the seats up there more shapely."

"Um well, let me..." you start to say, then realize what his question was. "I'm sorry, I didn't quite catch the last part of your question." Without realizing it, you reach down, tug on your skirt and smooth it both front and back.

"Sure. I said I find the first class seats to be a lot more comfortable than the ones in coach."

'Tony, get your head into the game' you think to yourself. You can do this.

"Yes sir. I'm sure we can do something for you." You take his name and enter it in the computer. The software was easy to manage, and in a minute or so you had put the man on a waiting list for a free upgrade. "Check back 15 minutes before boarding sir, and I can tell you if the seat is available. I can offer it to you for free if it is."

"Excellent. Thank you miss" he says, and heads to the waiting area.

Whew. You did that well Tony, er, Lucy. You can do this.

Another flight is getting ready to queue up from this gate. Before you have a chance to pat yourself on the back for a job well done so far, a line forms at your podium. You steel yourself up, stand proudly on your stilettos and face the forming crowd.

"May I help you, ma'am?" you ask the next woman in line. She's checking an oversized bag. You wave at Luna.

"Is there a problem, Lucy?"

"No, but Mrs..." (you look at her ticket) "Aardappel has a bag that's too large to fit under seat. I don't know how to check it."

"That's easy. Here." says Luna. Her fingers deftly move across the keyboard. A sticker pops out of the printer in the center of the podium. "We stick this on the bag and take it over there ->" Luna says, pointing across the way. You pick up the bag, apply the sticker and carry the bag the 15 or 20 steps to where Luna is pointing. The uniform has a way of walking by itself, and you realize you're swinging your hips suggestively as you walk the short distance. You realize that people are watching you because you misstepped slightly (still not used to the heels) and heard a few women gasp and someone behind you giggle.

On the way back after dropping off the bag, the men in line are smiling at you.

14121122221.content:
You handle the next person's booking whilst Luna is on the phone, and as you finish with your passenger, she ushers you to one side.

"We have a problem on the plane." she says. "They should have a cabin crew compliment of five, but they're already one girl down, and another has called in sick. We can't fly with only three in the cabin."

"So what'll happen?" you ask, fully aware that you have been checking in passengers for that flight. "Will the flight be cancelled?"

"If we can't find another stewardess in the next 15 minutes, yes."

"So, don't you have backups you can call on?"

"Oh yes, and we're trying, but we can't use anyone who has just flown in, as they've been on the go for the past 10 hours, and the only other one is out of town, so can't get here in time."

"So, what's left?"

"We use one of our ground staff from the airport."

"Oh right, that's OK then. So the problem can be solved."

"Oh yes... But there's just one issue remaining. The only available ground staff are you and me. Either one of us goes on the flight, or it doesn't take off!"

"What!" You realize you have exclaimed a little too loud, and people in the waiting queue are now trying to listen in on your conversation. You lower your voice to a controlled whisper. "I can't go - I wouldn't have a clue what to do. Besides. I'm..." You remember that Luna thinks you're their new female trainee, not merely a visitor from the local school. "I don't have my passport."

"Oh well, then you're going to be running the check-in desk for a while until someone else turns up if I have to go, as we haven't anyone else around...."

What will you do?

141211222211.content:
You realize that you're standing in front of Luna with your hands on your hips, swaying them gently back and forth as you think about your options, seemingly quite a natural at it. The male passengers in the area are watching you too, although as you have your back to them, you're unaware of the attention.

"Okay Luna," you say, "one of us has to go - I understand that. I've flown on flights as a passenger before, but would it be okay with the other girls if a complete novice takes the shift?" You said 'other girls' without even realizing it.

"Yes Lucy, it will be fine. Lindsay is the shift leader. She's used to new girls and once we explain the situation, she'll be fine with it."

"Great, Luna. I think it will be a fun experience."

"Yes it will Lucy. You'll need a change of clothes though. You have an overnight stop - your uniform will be fine for the trip back of course, but do you have extra underwear & stockings?"

"Err, no Luna. I don't. All I have is the stuff I came to the airport in."

Luna laughed. "That's what I thought. The hotel they'll put you up in is right next door to a Victoria's Secret. After you land, I suggest you head over there and get yourself something fresh for the trip back."

The thought of walking into a sexy women's underwear store scared the crap out of you. But still, would you be better off trying to figure out the complexity of the airline's computer system without Luna's help? No, you'd be better off in the plane serving drinks. No biggie. "Okay Luna, I think that's best option. Otherwise I'd probably send all these nice people to some god-awful place by mistake."

Smiling, Luna agreed. "Lucy, I know you probably don't have any credit cards with you, so here's some cash to take care of expenses while you're on the ground. Bring back the receipts so I can expense them, okay?"

"You got it Luna. I won't let you down!"

choices: Girl talk with Laura, the other girl working the drink cart with you
1412112222111.content:
You only have a few minutes before the flight is ready to board, so Luna takes your station by the computer. You pick up your bag of clothes. Really? Living the glamorous life of a stewardess with some boy's sweats and underwear in your ratty old backpack? You pick it up and Luna can tell by the look on your face that you see the same problem she does.

"Lucy", she starts, "would you like to borrow a bag for the flight? The airline gave us these funky old retro bags and I won't be needing it at the moment. I'll want it back, but you're free to borrow it for the flight if you'd like to."

"Oh, thanks Luna!" You haven't seen one of those round, flat bags since the ones in your sister's box of Barbie dolls. It seems awkward but it's better than a ragged pack you got at the clearance rack at REI. "Is there some place I..."

Before you can finish your sentence, Luna says "Sure, you can leave your stuff in a locker in the bathroom. Over there." pointing to the employee's lounge. Thanking her, you take the two bags and head over there. Without thinking you head for the men's bathroom and push the door open.

"Hey cutie, what do you think you're doing?" asks a tall man with stripes on his sleeves and an old fashioned leather aviator's cap.

You freeze. While Tony may have used this bathroom, Lucy certainly wouldn't be. "Oh, I'm sorry, I have the wrong door." The man looks you over head to toe.

"I must say cutie, the airline really has outdone themselves with the vintage stewardess uniforms. Unlike the ones they gave us." He made the face you'd expect from someone who had just eaten liverwurst ice cream and pointed to the leather aviator's hat. "I think the suits are trying to mess with us. Pilots in the 70s would have worn proper hats, not these, these barnstorming chew toys." He looks at your name tag. "Lucy is it? It's a pleasure meeting you. I'm Hank, Hank Krankzinnig, the pilot on flight 314."

You laugh in spite of yourself. This handsome man is clearly undressing you with his eyes as you're making excuses for entering the men's room. "Oh, um, hi Hank. Lucy Vanderhoek. I'll be on that flight, filling in. I guess I'm a little nervous."

"First time?"

"No", you reply, "I've been nervous lots of times."

Hank laughed. "Yeah, that's one of my favorite movies too. And don't worry, I won't call you Shirley."

Puzzled, you had no idea what he's talking about. You turn away from the door and walk with him in the direction of the ladies' room. When you get there, you thank him for his kindness. "Oh it's okay Lucy" he says. "Always happy to meet one of the new girls." As before when the uniform showed you how to walk like a girl, somehow it knows how to curtsey. You do, and Hank laughs. "I like you Lucy, you have a marvelous sense of humor." And with that he turns and heads off towards the gates.

Relieved, you open the ladies' room and walk in. There's a redhead not much older than you struggling with the zipper on her vintage dress. "Oh, excuse me" you say and divert your eyes. Then you realize that it's okay, you're wearing that same dress. "Can I get some help?" she asks. Your mother always taught you to be helpful, so you head over to her. "Here, let me get that" you offer, and pull the zipper up for her. She thanks you and you try not to notice as she hikes up her dress and fastens the tops of her stockings. "Thanks honey", she coos. "I don't think we've met. Are you new?" You explain that you were ground crew and got an emergency assignment to the flight. "Oh, then I hope we have to talk and get acquainted while we're in the air. Hey, thanks for the zip!"

You smile and find the lockers. You stuff your backpack in the back of one and then head out towards the gates carrying Luna's airline bag. Luna waves you on and buzzes the door to let you on to the plane. As you walk by, Luna tells you to look for Lindsay, winks at you and wishes you luck.

Already onboard is Hank, another man with the silly vintage helmet, a tall brunette with a tag that says 'Lindsay' and another girl. Lindsay comes up to you. "Hello Lucy, thanks for helping out on short notice."

"Oh, it's okay. Did Luna tell you that I haven't done this before?"

"No, I haven't had a chance to talk with her. It's no problem though. This flight is like any other. I assume you've flown this flight before - Hank recognized you as you were walking onboard."

"Oh no Lindsay. I only just met Hank in the men's room, er, I mean I accidentally walked into the men's room and bumped into him."

Lindsay scowls at you but then smiles. "Oh, I see. Well, what you do on your time is your business Lucy." Then whispering, "I want to hear all about it later". Hank is smiling at you from the cockpit.

The next few minutes are somewhat of a blur. Lindsay addresses the passengers with instructions. You follow her lead and fold down a jump seat as she does and try to act like you know what you're doing. Then Hank gets on the PA, tells you all about the weather and the plane begins to head down the runway. A few minutes later you're airborne. Lindsay unbuckles her belt, stands and folds up her seat. You do the same.

"Ladies and Gentlemen, we're going to begin our complimentary snack and beverage service. Please remain seated while the cart is in the aisle. Thank you, and we'll be with you shortly." Lindsay motions you towards the back of the plane while she heads forward. You thought walking on those heels was tough on earth -- with the slight buffeting of the plane it was near impossible to keep your balance. You manage though, and get to the back. The other girl is already unfastening the cart from stowage. A good thing too, as you would have never figured that out for yourself.

15431.content:
"HEY you perv, what are you looking at?" The voice of your older sister Amy startles you and you rapidly minimize the tab you were looking at on your computer.

You turn on your swivel chair and see your sister standing in the doorway of your bedroom. "Erm nothing" you try to say as innocently as possible "I was just on Facebook." At least you weren't lying when you said that.

"Yeah, but who were you looking at on Facebook?" she says slyly.

"Oh, er, just seeing what was going on, no one in particular."

Before you can stop her, Amy spins you around on your chair rendering you helpless to stop her opening the tab you had just been not so discretely looking at. A picture of a quite attractive looking girl fills the computer screen. https://i.pinimg.com/564x/25/f3/58/25f35...
As you stop spinning, all you can do is gape at your revealed secret.

"Ah ha, I knew it, you've got a crush on Kirsty!" Amy exclaims triumphantly.

Kirsty (the girl in the picture) is a year older than you at your school and one of your sister's oldest friends. You've had a crush on her forever but never really spoken to her. The past year has been hard for you since all your friends have got girlfriends and never seem to want to hang out, leaving you alone most of the time and the loneliness you felt only served to increase your longing for Kirsty. As far as you know she's never had a boyfriend which both encouraged you regarding her character but also discouraging you from asking her out as she (as far as you know) would almost certainly say no. Physically she's around 5 inches taller than you at 5ft 7 with an attractive but fairly unremarkable body. You get the impression she is kind hearted and funny from what your sister has told you about her and she always seems to wear more conservative clothes than most other girls at your school. Nevertheless you think she's the prettiest and coolest girl in school.

"Er, its not what it looks like." you say regaining your speech.

"Oh so you were just stalking her account is that it? Just wait till I tell mom." she starts for the door.

"NO WAIT!" you yell. She stops and looks over her shoulder smirking.

"Yeees?" she says.

You take a deep breathe, knowing you have to reveal you crush. "Okay its true, I do have a crush on Kirsty."

Your sister spins round. "Awww that's so cute. My little bro has a crush on one of my friends. I shouldn't so surprised I guess, this must be something every big sister has to go through."

"Okay okay you got me but please, you can't tell Kirsty." you say pleadingly.

"Why ever not?" Amy laughs "Its going to be the first thing I say to her tomorrow at school."

"Nooo please don't" you say almost begging now. "She'll think I'm a loser with you telling her but if I ask her she might..." you trail off as in your nervousness you may have overshared.

"Might say yes?" she continues "So you were planning on asking her out as well as drooling over her picture. Ooo, this is too good."

"Please no." you say again, tears starting to well up. "I really like her and don't want you to ruin it, please sis".

Amy's smile disappears at this and she looks at you with sympathy now rather than amusement. "Alright Tony I won't ruin your chances with Kirsty." she says soothingly.

"You promise?" you ask with a slight sniffle.

"Of course. I'm not that cruel, if you really like her and you're not being a creepy weirdo for once in your life, I won't try and stop it - although if she says yes, she may have wished I had." She gives you a grin and a playful nudge at this which you return with a grateful smile. "Anyway, family bonding over, mom sent me up to get you down for dinner."

"Okay, just let me shut down." You carefully logout of facebook, ensuring that there is no way you could get caught while out of your room, and then head down with Amy for dinner filled with both great relief and hope.

Amy didn't tell you to leave Kirsty alone, or that she was out of your league which she has done with girls you've liked previously, which fills you with hope that she might think that Kirsty may like you too.
15431.title: The girl

154311.content:
The following day at school passes uneventfully but at least its a Friday. Before going in you made Amy swear again that she wouldn't try and sabotage things between you and Kirsty to put your mind at ease. You wait at the gates and meet a couple of your friends to see if they want to hang out or even walk home with you, but no such luck. Each of them in turn apologizes and then leaves with their respective girlfriend, leaving you to walk home alone. You would have felt insulted but it's happened so often that you don't even care anymore, so you trudge home alone. You decide to take the scenic route through the old church yard to clear your head. You have frequented this spot more and more in the last year. It gives you some seclusion and time alone with your thoughts. On reaching the church, you sit in your usual spot against the wall and close your eyes and sigh heavily.

After about five minutes of dozing you hear crunching through the fallen leaves nearby. At first you ignore it thinking it a squirrel or something but the crunching gets louder and it soon becomes clear its too heavy for a critter and belongs to a person. The crunching gets closer seemingly metres away. Your eyes snap open in search of the source of the noise, weary that it may be a mugger or another sort of unsavory character considering your location. You look to the direction of the noise expecting to see a tramp or hobo but are shocked to see Kirsty, your crush, standing not 5 metres away from you, looking down at you while holding a leaf close to her face.

You don't know what to say, lost for words for two reasons. One that its your crush in front of you and another wondering what she is doing here in your quiet place. You watch her waiting for her to act first and she obliges.

"Don't you just love Autumn?" she says while taking a small sniff of the leaf she is holding before tossing it away. "All the leaves are so pretty and the smell is like nature coming to life." She smiles down at you waiting for you to respond.

"Er yeah, I guess I never really noticed it before." you almost stammer, still in shock that you are actually having this conversation.

Sitting down without complaint, you watch Kristy unzip a pocket on her backpack and pull out a first aid kit and then another similar sized kit. You should have thought to bring some yourself, but you were too anxious about your date. At least Kristy has been nice about all this and not thought you a real goof even as you got dressed in her clothes. You wonder what she meant by 'perking up.'

"OK. Close your eyes, and I'll get started."

As you close your eyes, you wonder why she wants you to close them. You could just put it on yourself. It's not like you haven't done that before.

"I can do it."

"No, let me. It's easier this way with this stuff. So just relax."

Well, no need to make a big issue about it. If she wants to do your face, why not. It's such a nice day with sounds and smells of the reeds and trees and lake. You try to imagine what each fragrance and sound may be.

As she starts to gently apply it to your forehead, it feels really good. And it doesn't feel all greasy as she massages it into your temples. It's very relaxing as her fingers lightly swirl over your cheeks and then nose and chin.

"Almost done," she explains. You're really enjoying this and are fine for however long it takes. She lightly brushes something over your eyes and under your eyebrows, then draws something once across on each eyelid. She pats your cheeks with something soft, and a whiff of flowers blows by. " OK, all done."

You open your eyes to see her packing the kits away, so you grab your dusty red pack and sling it over your shoulder. Helping with the tarp, it's folded so the wet side doesn't get on the dry. She adds it all the her much larger pack and begins to hoist it up. Being gentlemanly, you offer to take it, but she says since it's hers that she'll carry it.

As you walk out of the blind toward the main path, Kristy takes your hand and gives it a light squeeze. You squeeze back and smile at each other. It isn't until you're on the gravel trail that you remember that you're wearing her clothes - they fit so comfortably. But what if someone sees?
154311132311212331312131.title: Insist on looking for Cinnamon Teal?

choices: To take the lead and kiss her
Let her lead you back up the path
All that water makes you need to use the facilities
1543111323112123313121312.content:
With no one around except the warden, and he's already seen you so changing now could be a bit odd, you almost forget that you've swapped clothes and enjoy walking with Kirsty. It's a wonderful day, sunny with a hint of a breeze. Everything Kirsty has said and suggested has actually turned out fine, so you quickly forget about the clothes.

"I've never seen a Cinnamon Teal before," you offer excitedly.

"Me neither. This will be our first, so we should take our time and enjoy it."

As she squeezes your hand and winks, you can't help but wonder if Kirsty's words had another meaning. After all, you've already both removed your clothes once, although not done anything more than have a few peeks. You were too self-conscious for anything anyway. Eventually, you'll have to swap back. Perhaps you and Kirsty might do a little more then.

The two of you walk along talking in spurts about this and that. About half-way there, the sun is starting to feel very warm, and you're glad Kirsty did your face.

"It's warming up," you mention.

"Let's stop here in the shade a bit and see what we can do with that." You chuckle at her phrasing but follow her over beneath a small tree. "Viscum album," she states pointing up into the tree.

That isn't a bird's name, you're sure. So it must be the red berries and green pointed leaves hanging on one branch. It's interesting, but you don't know why, so you just say, "Oh, OK."

That makes Kirsty chuckle as she pulls you next to her, face-to-face. As you look up into her eyes, they sparkle, and you get a warm feeling all over. She runs her fingers through your hair before leaning in to kiss you. That warmth grows as does a tingling through your body as you press lips together. Your eyes remain closed with the wonderful sensations and you almost stumble backwards when she lets go.

"Mistletoe," she explains.

"Oh. That would explain the magic I felt." Immediately you blush at the lame phrasing and turn your glance down.

"No. That would be the natural part of you coming through now that you're more comfortable in how you should be." You don't know what to say or exactly what she means. Fortunately, she continues before you have to. "We should hydrate."

Kirsty pulls a small red bottle from her pack and hands it to you before she takes a blue one.

"Thanks." You take a big swig and then another. It's cool and refreshing water with just a hint of mint or something. You want to chug the whole bottle. Kirsty raises her eyebrow obviously noticing your thirsty guzzling. "I didn't realize I was so thirsty, although this does taste nice."

"Go ahead," Kirsty offers. "We can refill at the fountain later." You take another swig before closing the bottle while she rummages again in her pack. "You should put something on your lips to keep them from drying. Pucker up."

Instantly, you present your lips in an exaggerated way, smacking them a few times. Instead of a kiss though, Kirsty twists a tiny cylinder and applies something to them. When she's done, you purse them.

"Mmm. Strawberry."

"Now don't lick it off. It's to keep you moist and protected from the sun as well. Here, you can keep this one. I have another."

You trade the bottle for the little cylinder and start to put it in your pocket before you remember that Kirsty's leggings don't have pockets. You had completely forgotten that you were wearing her clothes and she yours. That freezes you for a moment until Kirsty, seeing you motionless staring at the lip ointment, suggests that you put it in the bag you have slung over your shoulder.

"We'd better get going before the birds go into their mid-day rest out of sight."

You look over at Kirsty as you tuck the cylinder in your bag and decide . . .

Before you know it, there's a small wood post with an arrow for the Brokenshall Hide. You debate whether to go inside or stop outside, and decide the latter. This time you help Kirsty put down the tarp instead of getting you bum sopping. You definitely don't want to get her leggings and boy shorts wet. Actually, until just then, you had not thought about wearing them or what anyone would think. Being with Kirsty was all that occupied you, and that felt good. You decide that you won't bring this back up and just enjoy your time together.

"Look carefully along the edges," she instructs you. After a few moments you feel her hands in your hair. It's nice especially when she starts brushing it out.

Wait. What?

As you start to lower the binoculars and ask, Kirsty explains. "It's sort of messy the way it was, we did it so quickly. You watch out for the Cinnamon Teal, and I'll just straighten this up a bit."

Well, OK. It feels good, and you feel good that Kirsty is taking such an interest in you. You concentrate on viewing and think about what it will be like sharing the Cinnamon Teal experience with Kirsty and how you two might celebrate.

After a few minutes, Kirsty has finished, so you lower the binoculars.

"Your turn," you suggest and offer the binoculars.

"Thanks."

She smiles at you for several moments before leaning in for a little kiss. You tingle all over as she releases you and winks. You watch her start scanning the lake when you realize that part of the tingling is your body telling you that you have to use the toilet.

"Um, I think I, um, need to use the facilities."

Without turning around, Kirsty informs you, "There's a portable a short way down the trail through the forest, or a nicer building a little further away along the lake trail. I'll stay here and watch our stuff. You go ahead."

"OK. Thanks."

You're still dressed in Kirsty's clothes, so it feels a little odd going off by yourself. Maybe you should go towards the forest since it's closer, but more people walk the forest trail. It will take you a lot longer and that could lead to encountering more people if you go to the facilities building - but there doesn't seem to be anyone around today. You decide to . . .

You have a choice of male of female - they haven't yet considered the concept of unisex restrooms here. If you do look like a girl, maybe you should be using the female restroom... Flip.
