just putting sun-cream on your face. She was styling your hair, and applying makeup! Hmm, they don't really look right. OK, maybe you need to pose differently. OK, not shots for sharing, but a memento for yourself of probably the weirdest day you'll ever have.

OK, long enough spent in here. Time to go.

You...

You now have two things on your mind. OK, not the rarest of birds, but you are sufficiently interested to stop and thank him for telling you, and ask him where it was. He tells you that the sighting was made from the Brokenshall Hide, so realistically that would be the best place to start looking.

However, you know you're not entirely sure what one looks like - you saw a picture of one in a book some months ago, but you're not at all sure if you'd recognise one if you saw it. Whilst you have had a crush on Kirsty, and sort of still do, this was before you knew about her wanting her boyfriends to dress up as girls. You have to admit that, aside from being a bit weird, it is actually a bit of a turn on, and having now dressed as a girl you could see it could be fun... but only occasionally. Fairly reluctantly you decide that the ribbing you'd take from your friends if they found out, plus the hassle you'd get from your mom really wouldn't be worth your while. So you're mind is therefore set that you'll get changed back into your own clothes again, and try to remain friends with Kirsty - although recognizing that this could be the end of a very short relationship.

You leave your sister at the reserve's information center and head back to the Brokenshall Hide where you'd left Kirsty earlier. She's still there, lying spread eagled in the sunshine next to the hide – still dressed in your tee shirt and shorts and looking every bit a boy, which for an instant is disconcerting until you remember you still look every bit a girl, so somehow that's OK. You sit down beside here, and she glances toward you. “Hello sweetie,” she says. “You were a bit longer than I'd expected. Everything OK?”

“Yes, I'm fine,” you reply, “...but.”

Hearing that there's something clearly not entirely right, Kirsty sits up, turns to face you, and grasps your hand. “But what, sweetie?”

Despite your intentions of confronting Kirsty, you remain somewhat reluctant to do so. You also don't really want to mention that you'd been talking to Amy, as that could upset their relationship. So, rather than blurting out what you had intended, you end up rather more reticent.

“Um, it's just that I'm not really that comfortable in these...” indicating Kirsty's clothes that you're wearing. “I think I'd prefer to get back into my stuff, if you don't mind.”

“OK. I understand. I'm sorry if I pushed you too far there. I know I can sometimes get a bit carried away with things. Was the make-up a bit too much for you?”

“Well, sort of. I thought I was a bit more in control of things than I was... and then seeing myself in the mirror...”

“Yes, I know.“ she replies. “Just answer me one thing first, and then you can get changed. When you looked at yourself in the mirror, did you like what you saw?”

“Um, well. I was a bit surprised. I thought I'd look like me wearing your clothes, but I didn't.”

“So, did you like what you saw, or not?”

“Well, yes, I guess.” you reply. This, to be honest was the truth. You had liked what you'd seen – a nice looking girl who looked a lot like you, which was why you took the selfies. But that doesn't change the fact that you feel you've been manipulated, don't want to dress like this all the time, and really would like your own clothes back now... you're just struggling to actually tell this to Kirsty.

“Good.” she replies. “I wouldn't be able to live with myself if you hadn't liked what you saw. I take a bit of pride in my handiwork with a make-up brush - although you're a good subject, so didn't need much work at all, to be honest.”

She continues speaking. “Look, I reckon we're pretty good together.” She reaches over and rests one hand on your leg, and gently caresses you thigh through the leggings. “If you're really not happy with this, then I'm sure we can work out something that suits better. I'd hate to think I've frightened you off. I do really like you..” and with that she leans forward and gives you a smacker of a kiss on your lips that takes your breath away.

Well, maybe you had misjudged her. That certainly didn't sound like someone quite as obsessed as Amy had suggested, so just perhaps there may be hope of keeping your relationship going.

"To be honest I don't think sitting right next to a hide full of twitchers watching the ducks is the best place to start undressing, so would you be OK if we stay like this just a little longer? Kirsty asks.

Her reasoning makes sense, so you agree.

"By the way," she continues, "Did you find out where the teals are?"

You'd pretty much forgotten about them, but then recall what the warden had said.

Whilst you'd never seriously considered it before, you've never fitted in with the boys at school, and barely had any boy / girl relationships with girls – they always seemed to treat you as a 'friend', rather than a 'boyfriend'. You hadn't previously given it more than a passing thought. But maybe Kieran's right. It's not just about what gender you are physically, but how you perceive the World, and perhaps how the World perceives you.

There's no way on this planet you'd ever consider you were a girl born into a boy's body, but you can see that in some areas you could fit the psychological profile of a girl equally as well as a boy. You can certainly cry like a girl, you think to yourself, and the thought of someone willing to protect you does make you feel safe. You've always had a preference for growing you hair long, you prefer girl bands to boy bands (although you've always convinced yourself you like looking at the girls rather than enjoying their music), and you follow tennis and netball rather than football. Of course, you also got a definite buzz getting dressed as a girl today. Not that any of that proves anything, of course...

However, somehow things are starting to make more sense now. Maybe Kieran isn't so odd after all, but just adapting as best he can. So, Kieran is the person he considers to be his real self, whilst Kirsty is his sort of alter ego – the version of himself he needs to fit his physical body, and he swaps between them as necessary.

So, you continue thinking, is it possible that you're really a girl inside, although physically a boy? No, you decide that's definitely a step too far. However you do recognize that you have a number of girlish characteristics. Perhaps adopting Teagan as your own alter ego could well be the way to focus these feminine strands of your psych into something more structured. Kieran seems to cope with swapping between his personalities easily enough, so it's clearly feasible to do. Surely it's a bit like character acting. You just immerse yourself completely in the character, the persona, and then swap personas when you need to.

So, having reached a tentative conclusion and decision, you clearly need to re-engage with Kieran, who's been patiently waiting, holding you tightly in his arms.

“I'm sorry,” you say, struggling to get your first word out after several minutes of crying, “I think I'm OK now. Thank you for being here for me, I do appreciate it.”

“So, how are you feeling? Have you decided anything?” You gaze up at Kieran and realize he's clearly quite worried and anxious about you.

“Yes, I have. I realize I've been deluding myself for a while, but you've helped see things in a different way. I think I'll need some help and guidance from you, but I think this could well be the right thing to do. I'm sorry I made such a fuss, but I needed to work it out in my head.”

“No worries my darling. And I'll gladly give you any help you need. So, do you feel up to doing anything yet?”

You glance at your watch, and realize that you'd effectively detached yourself from everything around you for over half an hour, feeling sorry for yourself and then contemplating your situation. You give it a few seconds thought. You know it would be impossible to try to be both Tony and Teagan at the same time, so you'll need to focus on being your alter ego for a while, and potentially give in to anything and everything you previously considered to have been girlish, and try to live your new persona. Actually, that could be quite a relief, not being worried that anything you do could be considered as un-boyish. OK, decision made.

“Yes, I think I need the bathroom first. My make-up is probably shot to pieces so I'll need to do something about that, and then something to eat. I'm famished.”

“You're on. Let's go inside. I'll check for a table, and you can head for the bathroom. You can borrow Kirsty's make-up bag. If you can't manage anything, I'll help later. I'd suggest you wash your face first though. You are a bit streaky from the tears.” He holds your hand as he leads to the the main entrance to the diner, then holds the door open for you. You go inside and see the sign for the restrooms. You turn to Kieran, who's gesturing you to go on. ”See you in a couple of minutes. Take as long as you need. I'm not going anywhere sweetie.”

You go into the Ladies rest room, this time without hesitation or the slightly bit of anxiety. You don't really need a pee, but decide to have one anyway. Then as you come out from the stall, you head for the washbasins, and have a look at yourself in the mirror. Ouch. Yes, the make-up that Kieran applied for you earlier couldn't cope with your tears, and your eyes and cheeks are a bit of a mess. With hot water and soap you wash your face over to remove the streaks, and inevitably most of the remaining make-up as well. You pat your face dry, then consider what to put on first. From recalling what Kirsty, or was it Kieran, had done earlier it was effectively top down, so you tackle your eyes first, then some make-up on your cheeks, and finish with a little lip stick. Whilst you're not entirely happy with the outcome, its understated rather than excessive, which you decide is preferable. As you're working on your make-up you're talking to yourself, reminding yourself that you're now Teagan, and you're a girl, and anything to do with Tony, your boy persona, needs to be pushed to the back of your mind for now.

With that in mind, you look at yourself in the mirror again, a little more critically. You reckon you could do with some jewelry, perhaps earrings and something around your neck. You like the material of the dress, but in all honesty don't think blue suits you best, and whilst appreciating that any semblance of breasts is technically an illusion, what you have seem a bit on the small side. You look down at yourself and decide whilst they're practical, the trainers will need to be replaced at some point by something more, well, more feminine. And your hands look, well, like hands. Not girl's hands. Why? Ah, yes, the nails – cut short and basically plain. Hmm, nothing you can do now, but something to consider for the future. You've decided that Teagan is going to be quite a girlie girl, and subconsciously that gives you another little buzz of excitement inside...

You head back out into the diner, and look around for Kieran.

1543111323112123313121312222212222121131.content:
"So, Teagan, what would you like to do now?"

You look at your watch and realize that it's already half way through the afternoon. Cripes, where has the time gone? You try to push back the little niggling voice reminding you that you'll have to go home soon, which means changing back into Tony's, um, or rather into your boy clothes, um, your clothes... Hmm, this is starting to get a bit more complex than you'd initially expected.

"I want to do something, um.." You realize you'll have to think about this one. Something really girlie? Something that Tony would never do? Something that further builds your confidence as being Teagan? Well, you've been doing all of them already. Something... um... "You know what?" you finally announce. "I'd really love an ice cream. It's really hot this afternoon."

"Sounds a pretty good idea to me!" Kieran replies. "There's a kiosk just along the road."

You walk along, and as you reach the kiosk you decide that this has got be your treat, and tell Kieran. This time he accepts, so you join the short queue. When the server finishing the order ahead of you, you do not respond as quickly as you should have when he asked "What would you like Miss?", but after the realization he's talking to you, all is well. You return to Kieran who's waiting on a bench overlooking a small park area, and sit beside him. He seems to be looking at something or someone in the park, so you try to follow his gaze. The only thing you can obviously see are two teenage girls sunbathing on the grass.

"What! You lost interest in me already? Eying up your next catch?" You ask, mostly in jest, although with a small amount of apprehension.

"No, nothing here that would even partially eclipse you. I was just wondering what color bikini would suit you best."

"What makes you think I'd want to wear a bikini?"

"You did. Back at the airport. We were talking about swimwear for our trip to the desert island, remember? You said you'd opt for a bikini..."

"Yes, but that was on the desert island, not here. Anyway, what color do you think would suit me?"

"Hmm. Nothing plain. I think you are a multi-colored sort of person, and to be honest the bohemian style seems to really suit you, so yes, multi colored, but in pastel shades. Not blue - too boyish, and probably not red - a bit too passionate. You're more subtle, perhaps ochre, or maybe teal. A bit like your bird earlier..."

Well, you have got to admit he's not bad on his assessment, as you pretty much agree. However, you're still not planning on getting a bikini any time soon. No, correct that. Any time. Period. You look across to the girls in the park. Sunbathing. Wearing next to nothing and not caring, and looking really sexy. Ouch. You realize you are having a bit of a mental dilemma. The boy in your is definitely ogling these girls now, whilst the girl in you is trying to fight the lustful feelings - but not very successfully. So Tony is hetrosexual. You know that already. but if Teagan likes girls as well, does than make her gay? But you like Kieran, and he's... well, technically a girl. Oh crap. You're a straight boy, but a gay girl? Is that even possible?

There's a boy in the park too - topless in a pair of shorts. You look at him, and, well.. he's just a boy. So is Teagan gay then? Does that even make sense?

"They are really nice looking, aren't they?" you ask, a bit uncertainly.

"They're OK, if you like girls."

"Do you like girls?" you ask.

"I thought we'd been through that one earlier..."

"OK, sorry." Yes, actually you remember that discussion now. "Um, what I meant was, as a boy, what are your feelings towards girls?"

Kieran seems to understand that you're no longer referring specifically to the girls in the park, and that there's clearly something troubling you.

"Let me guess. You've got the hots for one of them, and can't work out why?"

"No! Nothing like that!" You can feel yourself blushing. "I was just wondering if you, um, prefer girls or boys, or just... um, special girls..."

"If you mean do I look at girls the same way you would as a boy, the answer is no. But I also don't look at boys the same way you do. I guess I look at girls 'cos they're nice to look at... not because I want to take them to bed. Present company excepted, of course. I guess I look at some boys as they look nice, some to check out what I could do to look better myself, and some admittedly as potential girlfriends."

"So, you don't get the hots for any boys then?"

"Well, occasionally. There are some girls and some boys who'd turn just about anyone on, regardless of your gender or orientation. But not as the norm, no."

"Unless you can see their potential as a girlfriend?"

"Not whilst I have a girlfriend, no! I think we clarified earlier than I'm currently in a relationship, and I'm not looking to replace you yet."

...but you might if the right boy came along.. you think to yourself. So watch your step or you may be replaced... Ouch... Grief - a traditional boy / girl relationship would be easier to cope with mentally, that's for sure. But you also know that your success rate in a traditional boy / girl relationship is pretty much zero, as you just don't seem to hack it as a boy. So as Tony you like girls but get nowhere. As Teagan you also like girls, but mostly because you're really a boy, and there are some natural instincts you cannot subdue. But you like Kieran... although he's clearly a girl really, and you like him either way. Well, maybe not so much as boy - you like him because he's really a girl, but...

You feel your head spinning a bit. Your Teagan persona has pretty much given up the ghost at this point, and you feel like the umpire at a tennis match with Tony on one side of the net and Teagan on the other, batting arguments and viewpoints from their respective sides. Actually you feel more like the tennis ball, as all of the arguments seem to be hitting you, and hurting.

So, ultimately you're a bit of a failure as a boy. Trying to be a girl instead isn't really working as you clearly still like girls, which is weird, isn't it? So, where do you go from here?

You are aware of a noise interrupting your thinking. Kieran is talking to you, or at least trying to get your attention.
"Teagan... Hello... Earth to Teagan... Once he realizes you are actually focusing on him, he continues. "You may be trying to overthink this. You've got to try to put normal conventions to one side, and consider what is right for you. If you have the hots for those girls, then I wouldn't be offended. If you decide our relationship isn't what you want, I wouldn't be offended. If you want to go back to your life as it was before, that's your choice, but I think you decided it wasn't working and you needed something different where you could express those parts of you that were stifled before. I know its been challenging and confusing for you today, but you've proven that you're incredibly strong inside, and I'm really proud of what you've achieved. Both of you. Tony for accepting that a change was needed, and being prepared to let go, and Teagan for stepping up and being able to express your suppressed emotions and desires."

OK, so that makes you feel a bit better. A bit of confidence boosting goes a long way, and perhaps was what you needed. OK, so you have a get-out clause, so you're not tied into anything you don't want to do, but also reassured that what you've doing is right. Or at least right for you.

You realize that you are still trying to manage both perspectives – Tony and Teagan. Perhaps this is where you need to be at the moment. You're not entirely sure if you could really go back to just being Tony again. And Teagan, being the personification of those suppressed traits, is likely to get you into trouble if you're not careful. So, you'd need to give one or the other control at appropriate times, but effectively keep an eye on them... You... Whatever.

"I'm sorry," you say, "I went off again, didn't I?"

Well, in this situation you realize there is one thing you can pretty much rely on, which is Kieran.. or Kirsty, or, um, 'K'. Yes, that's it! It doesn't matter to you really which of her personas she's in as its the same person inside, so if you refer to her / him as K it could well be easier to focus on the person rather than the persona.

"You know what?" you continue, " I've been struggling all day to work out what to call you. You know, a nickname. I can't keep calling you Kieran all the time. I can't call you sweetie 'cos you call me that, and besides it wouldn't really fit. I can't call you, um, I don't know, honey, or hottie, or anything. What I can call you is 'K'.

"You mean like in 'Men in Black'?"

"Um, oh, yes. Yes, just like that. My own agent K."

"OK, I quite like hottie," he winks, "but guess I could live with K. Not sure they had an agent T though, so I may not be able to reciprocate."

"Sweetie's fine," you reply. "Well, when I'm a girl anyway." But you realize you may actually adopt 'T' as being your umpire perspective - your overview between Tony and Teagan. You recall there had been an agent T, but he was decommissioned. So, you could be the new T, in control of your two competing parts. Maybe, just maybe, this could work...

Kay opens up the garage door and you park your bikes inside. He then leads you into the house, and shows you around. He has his own en-suite bathroom, and a closet that you reckon is even bigger than his bathroom, with rails and racks of clothing laid out in two distinct sections – the left side for girl clothes and the right side for boy clothes - almost if a brother and sister shared the closet, keeping everything separated.

You find yourself scanning across the dresses, shirts, blouses and skirts hanging there.

That's the agreement we have."

"Yes, of course. But you don't look sexy, I mean, um, girly sexy, like Kirsty does..."

"Yes, but..."

Kay holds you gently by each shoulder and looks directly into your eyes. "Commitment. Absolute and total commitment. No half measures. No doubts and wondering what the other might say. Each has got to trust the other implicitly and let them do whatever they need to."

Wow, you can almost feel the words hitting you consciousness, and you know he's right.

So, Teagan will have 100% control for the next 24 hours unless there's a crisis. OK? Both of your mental selves agree, albeit one more reservedly than the other. OK, be good. Off you go... You mentally swap places, and feel the umpire Tee evaporate away, leaving you as Teagan.

Again you agree, a curt nod of agreement, to keep your disguise secret you'll have to struggle with English.

"You're unable to tell anyone else who you are."

The final command makes you want to gasp, to splutter and protest at it's obviousness. If you want to pass, you'll have to convince everybody else. At the back of your mind, deep inside, a sense of wrongness passes over you.

"There you are Chang Fu."

Maureen's hand pats your shoulder, and you bat your eyelashes as if waking, and look around the lovely room. It's as if a spell broke, or a hypnotist snapped her fingers. But you feel refreshed and invigorated.

info.brief_description: You're a boy, soon to be dressing as a girl. How? Why? What will happen? - Please add!!!
info.description:
You're a boy, but unknown to you at the outset of the story, you are going to end up either behaving as, or dressing as a girl!

Will this happen willingly, by force, coercion or by accident? Will it happen at once, over a period of time, or perhaps an item at a time. Only you can decide!

Additions and feedback welcome. If you like my writing style and are content with my direction of travel, that's great. But if you prefer a new or different direction for the story then please add a chapter to lead the story that way, and I'll try to pick it up.

However, this is intended to be a story, not a succession of options. Contributions / additional chapters welcome, but please ensure any one-liners add something relevant. Please try to keep the narrative in the 2nd person throughout (i.e. you...). If I make any alterations to anything from another author, this would be limited to spelling, grammar, and continuity of the story.

Please enjoy - and please contribute!
